Question:
We seek to learn a classifier on the following data set given in (point, class) format: ((-3,6),-1),((-1,6),-1),((2,6),+1),((4,6),-1),((-3,5),-1),((-1,5),-1),((2,5),+1),((4,5),-1),((2,3),+1),((4,3),-1),((2,2),+1),((4,2),-1),((-1,1),+1). 
We first learn a linear logistic classifier with offset on this data set, with no regularization. Will it obtain zero training error? Write “yes” or “no” and explain your answer
Solution: No, this data set is not linearly separable.
